title: Adjust global background-size to 100% auto / auto 100%

requirements.text: Update the global background CSS in `frontend/src/index.css` so the `body` background uses `background-size: 100% auto` or `background-size: auto 100%` (instead of `contain`) to test which option yields better alignment/visibility for the full background image, while keeping the existing background image asset references, `background-repeat: no-repeat`, and current positioning unless changes are required for the new sizing mode.

quotes: Can you try background-size: 100% auto or auto 100%

acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/index.css` no longer uses `background-size: contain` for the `body` background and instead uses `background-size: 100% auto` and/or `background-size: auto 100%` as the applied value(s).
The background image remains not tiled (`background-repeat: no-repeat`) and continues to use the existing image-set asset URLs.
The app builds successfully and the background renders without obvious cropping introduced by the chosen sizing mode on both mobile and desktop breakpoints.

constraints: Do not change any background image asset filenames/paths currently referenced in `frontend/src/index.css`.
Do not edit files under `frontend/src/components/ui` or other immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
nonGoals: Changing the actual background image assets.
Implementing a user-facing toggle or settings control to switch between background-size modes.
